page.title: 13CHANGING TIMES CONTINUED
page.content: Little change followed until the {Beeching Cuts }of the early 60s,many railway employees lost their jobs. Fortunately this co-incided with the development of ski-ing on a large scale in the Cairngorm Mountains and the subsequent opening of hotels at {Coylumbridge }and{Aviemore Centre. Much employment,for both men and women was created.Since then, Aviemore has expanded rapidly,many new shops, houses,restaurants,pubs and leisure facilities have been built to cater for the all year round tourist trade. Some of the older,{local residents who we interviewed during our survey are of the opinion that the village was better as it used to be,quiet and peaceful,everyone knowing everyone else.Most however are happy to accept the changes which progress and development have brought.
